meanings.definition: Easily understood or done; presenting no difficulty.
meanings.sent1: Math is the simplest subject for me.
meanings.sent2: The instructions were written in the simplest language possible.
meanings.sent3: It was the simplest puzzle ever, with only four pieces.
meanings.sent4: Her explanation was as clear and simple as the simplest math problem.
meanings.sent5: The simplest way to solve this is to follow the steps one by one.

meanings.definition: Free from elaboration or artificiality; plain.
meanings.sent1: She preferred the simplest dress for the party.
meanings.sent2: The room was decorated in the simplest style, with just a few flowers.
meanings.sent3: His excuse was so simple, it was almost the simplest thing he could have said.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as clear and simple as the simplest melody.
meanings.sent5: The simplest design is often the most elegant and beautiful.

meanings.definition: Having few parts or features; not complicated.
meanings.sent1: The simplest machine in the workshop was the lever.
meanings.sent2: The recipe was the simplest one she had ever seen, with only three ingredients.
meanings.sent3: His plan was so simple, it was almost the simplest plan in history.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as simple and bright as the simplest flower.
meanings.sent5: The simplest solution is often the most effective in these situations.
